Articles.Content: Recently there was another proof that space junk is becoming more and more a problem for everybody.

As I understand it, there have already been a couple collisions on orbit already. Most of them have been fairly minor (like a piece of paint hitting a comms satellite), but as more collisions occur the problem will obviously be exacerbated by any new debris generated from those collisions.
Yeah, most colissions up to now were minor, altough we had a full-fledged satellite collision in 2009. So, I'd say it's the chances of having a ablation cascade is becomming a real problem.
